content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.42 - Registration and inspection of tank and refueling service vehicles required

State Regulations

That the presence in or upon an air terminal of a
tank vehicle and refueling service vehicle is likely to endanger persons or
property in or upon the air terminal and render the use of the air terminal
unsafe, and no such tank vehicle and refueling service vehicle shall be allowed
in or upon any air terminal unless it shall conform to the following rules and
regulations in addition to all other rules and regulations for the use of the
air terminals: (a) No tank vehicles and
refueling service vehicles shall be used for transportation of flammable
liquids within airports unless registered, inspected and approved by the Port

Authority. (b) Every application for
registration, inspection or reinspection of such tank vehicle and refueling
service vehicle shall be made upon forms prescribed and furnished by the Port

Authority accompanied by a detailed, authorized statement certifying compliance
with the provisions of this section. (c) Vehicles shall be submitted for
registration and inspection prior to their use upon the airport and shall be
submitted for reinspection every six months thereafter. (d) Vehicles approved by the Port Authority
shall be furnished an initial registration certificate to be kept on the air
terminal, and inspection identification which shall be subject to the six
months' inspection and each portion shall be furnished a separate registration
certificate, and bear a separate inspection
identification. Notes
